observations: The central non-zero region in the input is mirrored in the output.
The non-zero shape is reflected vertically, horizontally or both, depending on the example.
Zero cells remain zero in the output.
Some zero cells become non-zero cells based on reflections of the non-zero region.
The central non-zero figure appears to be reflected symmetrically with respect to the center of the grid.
hypotheses: The output is generated by reflecting the central non-zero pattern across both horizontal and vertical axes.
The output is generated by reflecting the central non-zero pattern across the horizontal axis.
The output is generated by reflecting the central non-zero pattern across the vertical axis.
The output is generated by reflecting the central non-zero pattern by rotating 180 degrees around the center of the grid.

rejected_hypotheses.hypothesis: The output is generated by reflecting the central non-zero pattern across the horizontal axis.
rejected_hypotheses.reason: In training example 1, the non-zero pattern is reflected vertically, not horizontally.

rejected_hypotheses.hypothesis: The output is generated by reflecting the central non-zero pattern across the vertical axis.
rejected_hypotheses.reason: In training example 2, the non-zero pattern is reflected horizontally, not vertically.

rejected_hypotheses.hypothesis: The output is generated by reflecting the central non-zero pattern by rotating 180 degrees around the center of the grid.
rejected_hypotheses.reason: In training example 4, the non zero pattern is mirrored across both axis not rotated.

selected_rule: The output is generated by reflecting the central non-zero pattern across both horizontal and vertical axes.
step_plan: Identify the central non-zero pattern in the input grid.
Combine the original pattern with its horizontal and vertical reflections to form the output grid. All other cells are zero.
